Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection

Class RootDetector

java.lang.Object
com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.RootDetector
public class RootDetector extends Object
This class detects whether the device on which it is running is rooted.

Root privileges provide complete control over the environment and the app. The user or the controlling code could thus subvert the intended functionality of the app.

Rooting tools often try to hide the fact that a device is rooted, so root detection is necessarily based on a series of heuristics. These heuristics can result in false positives and false negatives:

  • False negatives: the detector may fail to flag that a device is rooted, if the rooting tool is successfully hiding itself.
  • False positives: the detector may flag a device that is not rooted as rooted, typically if it has unusual firmware, rooting-related applications, or maybe other traces of previous rooting or rooting attempts.
Depending on the application, receiving false positives may be highly undesirable. The API therefore provides a number of flags to reduce the number of false positives, at the cost of increasing the number of false negatives. For example, you can disregard the presence of apps that are only useful on rooted devices.

Because of the heuristic nature of the detection, and because rooting by itself does not necessarily imply bad intentions, many users may be inconvenienced and annoyed if your app refuses to run when their devices are flagged as rooted. We therefore strongly recommend to only use this detector as part of a risk analysis for the functionality of the app, not to block it entirely.

For more directly detecting dynamic attacks on your application, you should consider HookDetector, EmulatorDetector, and DebugDetector.

For checking the integrity of your apk file and its contents, you should consider the reliable ApkTamperDetector and CertificateChecker. These detectors complement and protect the other checks well.

Note that historically, certain checks relied on detecting that potentially malicious applications were installed on the device. In applications targeting API 30 or above, running on Android 11 or above, the QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission is required to detect the presence of such applications on the system. This is a "high risk" permission, which needs to be allowed by the Google Play store through a separate procedure. If it is not provided, checks relying on the permission are skipped.

    IGNORE_BINARY_EXISTENCE
    Don't consider the presence of an 'su' binary on the system as evidence of rooting.
    static final int
    NO_CIRCUMSTANTIAL
    Don't consider circumstantial evidence as evidence of rooting, like the presence of apps that are only useful on rooted devices.
    static final int
    NO_FAIL_ON_HOOKING
    Deprecated.
    Root detection will always fail if the check was tampered with.
    static final int
    NO_ROOT_MANAGERS
    Don't consider root manager apps being installed as evidence of rooting.
    static final int

    Don't consider applications whose sole purpose is to hide from root detection libraries.

  • Field Details

    • SILENT

      @Deprecated public static final int SILENT
      Deprecated.
      Root detection will always run in silent mode.
      Never pop up UI for the user, even on a rooted device. Please note this reduces effectiveness of the test.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NO_TRICK_APPS

      public static final int NO_TRICK_APPS
      Don't consider applications whose sole purpose is to hide from root detection libraries. In practice, some users install such apps without their devices actually being rooted.

      Note that in applications targeting API 30 or above, running on Android 11 or above, the QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission is required to detect certain applications being installed. This is a "high risk" permission, which needs to be allowed by the Google Play store through a separate procedure.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NO_CIRCUMSTANTIAL

      public static final int NO_CIRCUMSTANTIAL
      Don't consider circumstantial evidence as evidence of rooting, like the presence of apps that are only useful on rooted devices. In practice, some users install such apps without their devices actually being rooted.

      Note that in applications targeting API 30 or above, running on Android 11 or above, the QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission is required to detect certain applications being installed. This is a "high risk" permission, which needs to be allowed by the Google Play store through a separate procedure.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NO_FAIL_ON_HOOKING

      @Deprecated public static final int NO_FAIL_ON_HOOKING
      Deprecated.
      Root detection will always fail if the check was tampered with.
      Don't consider the device rooted if our check itself was tampered with.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • IGNORE_BINARY_EXISTENCE

      public static final int IGNORE_BINARY_EXISTENCE
      Don't consider the presence of an 'su' binary on the system as evidence of rooting. In practice, quite a few unofficial firmwares ship with 'su' present.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NO_ROOT_MANAGERS

      public static final int NO_ROOT_MANAGERS
      Don't consider root manager apps being installed as evidence of rooting. In practice, some users install such apps without their devices actually being rooted.

      Note that in applications targeting API 30 or above, running on Android 11 or above, the QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES permission is required to detect certain applications being installed. This is a "high risk" permission, which needs to be allowed by the Google Play store through a separate procedure.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      Checks whether the device has been rooted.

      Returns:
      0 if not rooted.

    • isDeviceRooted

      @Deprecated public static int isDeviceRooted(android.content.Context context, int ok)
      Deprecated.
      Checks whether the device has been rooted.
      Parameters:
      context - application context, allows for more checks.
      ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
      Returns:
      the value passed to ok if not rooted.

    • isDeviceRooted

      @Deprecated public static int isDeviceRooted(android.content.Context context, int ok, int flags)
      Deprecated.
      Checks whether the device has been rooted.
      Parameters:
      context - application context, allows for more checks.
      ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
      flags - a series of optional flags allows to limit testing.
      Returns:
      'ok' if not rooted, an error code indicating which test failed otherwise.

      context - application context, allows for more checks.
      callback - the callback to execute when the root check completes.
